name: individualistically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to one particular person rather than a group or society, or to someone who is different or original: Humans seem hardwired to conceive of ourselves individualistically. People are dressing more individualistically and creating their own style. See
individualism
More examplesFewer examplesPeople are immensely diverse – culturally, historically, individualistically.The more we rely on our public self to guide us and make decisions, the less individualistically we think and behave.Most jam bands are known for the talent and ability of their members to improvise individualistically.
